meanings.definition: Capable of being tasted or perceived by the sense of taste.
meanings.sent1: The soup was gustable, allowing me to savor its flavors.
meanings.sent2: The ripe strawberries were so gustable that everyone enjoyed them.
meanings.sent3: The gustable chocolate cake disappeared quickly at the party.
meanings.sent4: Her voice was as gustable as a melody, soothing and sweet.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked bread made the whole kitchen gustable.

meanings.definition: Having a pleasant or agreeable taste.
meanings.sent1: The cookies were gustable, making them a hit with the kids.
meanings.sent2: The chef ensured that every dish was gustable and satisfying.
meanings.sent3: The gustable ice cream melted too fast on the hot day.
meanings.sent4: The sunset painted the sky with gustable colors, a feast for the eyes.
meanings.sent5: The warm apple pie was so gustable that it brought back childhood memories.
